intro: Hakea lullfitzii, commonly known as the Lullfitz hakea, is a shrub native to the coastal regions of Western Australia. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and distinctive, woody spikes that bear small, urn-shaped flowers. The plant produces red or orange seeds that are dispersed by animals, contributing to its ecological role in the region. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to the harsh, arid conditions of its native habitat. Hakea lullfitzii is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
